metadata.title: CVE-2023-1625 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An information leak was discovered in OpenStack heat. This issue couldallow a remote, authenticated attacker to use the 'stack show' command toreveal parameters which are supposed to remain hidden. This has a lowimpact to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

heat-api - 1:14.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
heat-api-cfn - 1:14.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
heat-common - 1:14.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
heat-engine - 1:14.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
python3-heat - 1:14.2.0-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: heat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:14.2.0-0ubuntu1.1').
